required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Lutein, Zeaxanthine and Trypan Blue to Stain the Anterior Lens Capsule
clinical_study.official_title: A Descriptive Study to Evaluate the Efficacy of the Dye Compound of the Combination of Lutein, Zeaxanthin and Trypan Blue to Stain the Anterior Lens Capsule During Cataract Phacoemulsification.

brief_summary.textblock: Effectiveness of lutein, zeaxanthin and trypan blue to stain the anterior lens capsule during cataract phacoemulsification.

detailed_description.textblock: Twenty patients with cataract (nuclear, entumecente, total) and indication for cataract surgery will be selected to participate in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Visibility of the anterior lens capsule after the injection of dye
primary_outcome.description: The visibility of the anterior lens capsule after the injection of dye, should be graduated as Bad OR Fair OR Good OR Fine

secondary_outcome.measure: Degree of impregnation of the dye
secondary_outcome.description: The degree of impregnation of the anterior lens capsule by the dye should be graduated acording to the following scale:(0)not flushed; (1)stained weakly (light green); (2)moderately stained (medium green); (3)stained intensely (dark green)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the cataract surgery
secondary_outcome.description: the physician should evaluate the usufelness of the dye, according to the following scale: Bad, Fair, Good, Fine

arm_group.arm_group_label: dye of lutein, zeaxanthin, trypan blue
arm_group.description: during the surgery will be evaluated if the dye is suitable for dyeing anterior lens capsule

intervention.intervention_name: dye of lutein, zeaxanthin, trypan blue
intervention.description: dye composed of lutein, zeaxanthin, trypan blue
intervention.arm_group_label: dye of lutein, zeaxanthin, trypan blue
intervention.other_name: combination of lutein, zeaxanthin, trypan blue

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Patients over 50 years
- Diagnosis of cataract (nuclear, entumecente, total)
- Absence of red reflex
- Indication of cataract surgery
Exclusion Criteria
- Posterior subcapsular cataract
- Any history of eye disease
- Glaucoma
- Eye infection affecting any structure prior ocular
- Any previous ocular surgery

facility.name: Dept. of Ophthalmology - UNIFESP/Hospital São Paulo

reference.citation: Vianna LM, Cohen MJ, Muccioli C, Lima A, Sousa-Martins D, Maia M, Belfort R Jr. Efficacy of a lutein-based dye (Phacodyne™) for visualizing anterior capsulorhexis during cataract surgery by phacoemulsification. Arq Bras Oftalmol. 2014 May-Jun;77(3):173-7.
